availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William P. Brashear (Larue co. farmer, pvt 1st Ky light artillery )

body.p: Larue County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William Brashear and Amanda Brashear. Resident of Larue County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in 1864. Served in the 1st Kentucky Light Artillery (U.S.A.) as a private and corporal from September 10, 1863, to July 26, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 510, 519.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Larue County, Hamilton's District, p. 405B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0147.
